definition[0]: the most important ship in a group of ships belonging to the navy
definition[1]: the best and most important product, building etc that a company owns or produces
example[0]: the flagship of the new Ford range
example[1]: The firm has just opened a flagship store in Las Vegas.
definition[2]: a flagship product is the best and most important one that a company produces
example[3]: The St. Louis based brewer, Anheuser-Busch, has just launched a new advertising campaign for its flagship brand, Budweiser.
definition[3]: a flagship company is one of the best in its industry or country
example[4]: The UK’s flagship airline BA is facing increased competition from smaller carriers.
definition[4]: a flagship building is the best and most important one that a company owns
example[5]: Over a quarter of annual sales still come from the company’s flagship store on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan.
